intro: Echium masguindalii, commonly known as the Masguindal's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are generally hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and branching. Echium masguindalii is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
